page.title: 15WATERS OF DEANSTON DISTRICT
page.content: The fast flowing RIVER TEITH rolls over the dam at Deanston and flows down towards the Bridge of Teith, bounded by the mainly conifer Wood of Doune on the north & the road on the south. Many salmon & sea-trout pass up through this stretch of river each year on their way to the spawning grounds. Water is drawn from the Teith to form a lade, a channel of water, once used to drive the mill wheels & later turbines in Deanston works. LOCH WATSTON is in a picturesque setting of trees & fields. Access is by a path from Loch-hill Toll.Once a haunt of local anglers, now silted up, it is a haven for geese & other birds. Other small burns in the area include ASHMILL BURN which flows from the Watston farmlands in an easterly direction to join the Teith south of Doune Castle.
